books.description: A novel by Harper Lee published in 1960. It is a coming-of-age story about racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

review.name: Bob Smith
review.comment: A powerful narrative that addresses serious issues with warmth and humor. Essential reading.

books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale, written by the English writer George Orwell. It examines the dangers of totalitarianism.

review.name: Carol Williams
review.comment: A chilling portrayal of a dystopian future. The themes are more relevant today than ever.

books.description: This article is about the novel series. For the character, see Harry Potter (character). For the film series, see Harry Potter (film series). For the franchise, see Wizarding World. For the universe, see Fictional universe of Harry Potter. For other uses, see Harry Potter (disambiguation).
